de.dosmike.sponge.megamenus.api.elements.concepts

Interface IElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.spongepowered.api.util.Identifiable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISizeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IElementImpl, MButton, MCheckbox, MIcon, MLabel, MSlot, MSpinner

    public interface IElement
extends org.spongepowered.api.util.Identifiable
    Generic Interface shared by all elements placeable on a IMenu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GUI_ACCESS_NONE 
      static int GUI_ACCESS_PUT 
      static int GUI_ACCESS_TAKE

      This field defined whether the items in this slot of the GUI can be taken by a player or placed by one.

      Uniquely identifies this element within the menu.
      This ID may not be copied by copy(), use a new random one.
      void hookThinkTick(Tickable hook)
      A single object that can be registered to implement more complex behaviour.
      Should get called along with the IIcon animation updated about once a tick.
      default void invalidate()
      Invalidates this elements Menu for all Renderer through the RenderManager.
      default void invalidate(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
      Invalidates the Renderer matching this elements menu and viewed by the specified player, resulting in an inventory update for that player in the near future (usually next tick).

      This is an internal method that validates various render related information for this element

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        <T extends IElement> T copy()
        It is quicker for the elements to implement this method, than to use reflection to determine field to copy. Example: A Button extends IElement should implement this as 
         public Button copy() {
   Button copy = new Button(...);
   ... // element specific values to copy
   return copy;
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - the Implementation class
        Returns:
        a copy of this element with the same values

      • getUniqueId

        java.util.UUID getUniqueId()
        Uniquely identifies this element within the menu.
        This ID may not be copied by copy(), use a new random one.
        Specified by:
        getUniqueId in interface org.spongepowered.api.util.Identifiable
        Returns:
        a unique id for this element within the menu.

      • getIcon

        IIcon getIcon(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        If you intend to display this element in a inventory menu this should return a IIcon. These are possibly animated ItemStackSnapshots. If null is returned the slot will be rendered empty, this means no interaction is possible.
        Parameters:
        viewer - The viewer this icon is currently rendered for.

      • getName

        org.spongepowered.api.text.Text getName(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        For GUI rendering this replaces the item name of the icon and is optional, for Text rendering this equals the textual representation.
        Returns:
        the Text to display instead of the Item name, or null, if the icon shall specify

      • getLore

        java.util.List<org.spongepowered.api.text.Text> getLore(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Overwrites the icons lore on GUI rendering, or adds hover text on Text rendering.
        Returns:
        the Lore to display instead if the items one, or null, if the icon shall specify

      • getPosition

        org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos getPosition()
        This value is only relevant for GUIs. It returns where the element is positioned within the inventory space.
        If this returns null the element will not render.
        Returns:
        the X and Y coordinated within the menu page

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos position)
        Can move the item on the page it is put on.
        If you want to query the PositionProvider to set this elements position, use either the Builder. Auto positions become unavailable once the element is placed.
        The inventory will always be 9 wide, but the height depends on how the menu was initialized.
        Note that elements can overlap and ALL overlapping elements will receive interaction events at once!
        Parameters:
        position - The new X and Y coordinated to render this element at.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the position provided is null, but the element was already added to the menu.

      • getParent

        IMenu getParent()
        This will return the IMenu the Element was added to
        Returns:
        the IMenu this IElement was added to

      • getAccess

        default int getAccess()
        This field defined whether the items in this slot of the GUI can be taken by a player or placed by one. This returns a logical combination of the GUI_ACCESS_* values.
        Default value = GUI_ACCESS_NONE
        Returns:
        the inventory access permissions for this element

      • renderGUI

        java.util.Collection<org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos> renderGUI(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Takes the IICon, adds element specific data and returns it to be rendered in a inventory menu.
        Parameters:
        viewer - the actual player requesting this IElement to render
        Returns:
        all affected slots by this element

      • renderTUI

        default org.spongepowered.api.text.Text renderTUI(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Decorates a textual representation with the same Hover-Text as a inventory icon and returns it
        Parameters:
        viewer - the actual player requesting this IElement to render
        Returns:
        The Text-Object to append to a Text rendering

      • validateGui

        void validateGui(int pageHeight)
          throws ObjectBuilderException
        This is an internal method that validates various render related information for this element
        Parameters:
        pageHeight - Information on the height of the display GUI
        Throws:
        ObjectBuilderException - if an error occurred

      • think

        boolean think(AnimationManager animations,
              org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Copied from MenuRenderer::think
        this method shall update all animated IElements within the menu.
        Parameters:
        animations - is a tracker to prevent double frame advancement for shared anim objects
        viewer - the Player currently viewing this element
        Returns:
        true if an animation progressed during this think tick and the menu needs to redraw.

      • hookThinkTick

        void hookThinkTick(Tickable hook)
        A single object that can be registered to implement more complex behaviour.
        Should get called along with the IIcon animation updated about once a tick.
        Parameters:
        hook - A implementation of Tickable that will be notified on ticking

      • invalidate

        default void invalidate()
        Invalidates this elements Menu for all Renderer through the RenderManager. This will cause a redraw in the near future (usually next tick).

      • invalidate

        default void invalidate(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Invalidates the Renderer matching this elements menu and viewed by the specified player, resulting in an inventory update for that player in the near future (usually next tick).
